events.name: IWD Fredericton 2019
events.description:
We are proud to celebrate the 2019 International Women's month, to highlight the stories of our growing female community of designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs in New Brunswick.

You will meet us 3 days this month with amazing women innovations in Fredericton :

=================
March 15th , 2019
=================
The Future Is _ : A night of appreciation and recognition
@Wu conference centre
By: Women for Atlantic - Youth Chapter
https://www.facebook.com/W4AYouthChapter
-----------------------------------------------------------
This day will be an opportunity to celebrate empowerment, leadership, and diversity not only for the W4A Youth Chapter, but for all groups seeking to promote equality for all peoples in the UNB Community. Our goal is to show appreciation to these groups for their hard work and success this year, and to showcase what the future has to hold for UNB. The high point of this event will be the presentation of a scholarship, decided and awarded by the Board of Women for Atlantic. Most importantly, our event will be an opportunity to come together and take pride in ourselves, and be inspired to pursue our missions for years to come.

=================
March 23rd, 2019
=================
Girls STEM Up Conference
@ Fredericton Convention Centre
By: Girls STEM
https://www.facebook.com/girlsstemup
-----------------------------------------------------------
Girls STEM Up is Atlantic Canada's first conference geared towards empowering women in STEM, as well as, fostering allyship and celebrating diversity. ‚ú® We encourage everyone to be part of this conversation, meet and interact with prominent STEM organizations/ inspirational speakers, and overall, be an agent for positive change!

=================
March 24th, 2019
=================
Afternoon with Women in Engineering
@ Head Hall, UNB
By: UNB Diversity Within Engineering
https://www.facebook.com/diversitywithinengineeringUNB
-----------------------------------------------------------
This day will be a panel discussion with professional engineers, it will focus on diversity in the workplace, and interesectionality. This event will be taking place in Head Hall, please register for free to RSVP your seat.

Will have great speakers coming from all over New Brunswick, WTM Celebration Event is not restricted for women only, we would love to welcome everyone to share our happiness and the inspiration in Tech Society in New Brunswick

events.name: Cloud Study Jam Fredericton

venue.name: https://lib.unb.ca/about/facilities/milham.php
venue.address_2: found in Room 100 on the main floor of the HIL.

events.description:
Join us for our Cloud Study Jam!

Get official Google training, a $55+ value, free of charge. Together we'll work through several Google Cloud labs. You will get hands-on experience with topics and services that appear in the Google Cloud Certified Associate Cloud Engineer Certification.

Then after our live session, you will have FREE access to more labs you can finish at home. Complete all labs in the quest and earn a Google-hosted BADGE for your online profile, and additional 30 DAYS access to the training platform to compete any labs you want.

This Study Jam assumes little to no prior knowledge in cloud computing or with the Google Cloud Platform. It is expected that students have an information technology or computing background, and have some hands-on familiarity with administering computing systems. Prior work with shell environments / command line interfaces will be helpful for completing the labs in this series.

Bring a laptop and charger (PC, Mac or Chromebook)! The labs will run on all the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, make sure your laptop has Firefox or Chrome installed. Don‚Äôt forget your charger. :D

https://google.qwiklabs.com/quests/23

Until we get this unlocked, you can have a quick look at the whole quest that we will play with, and the labs that we will practice together.

Also we may have small GIFTS for you :D

-------------------
Our Agenda:
=============
3:00 pm --- Welcome!
3:05 pm --- Get free access to Qwiklabs
3:10 pm --- Lab 1: You‚Äôll learn how to create a Google Compute Engine virtual machine
3:45 pm --- Lab 2: Getting Started with Cloud Shell & gcloud
4:10 pm --- Lab 3: Provision Services with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) Marketplace
4:45 pm --- Break
5:15 pm --- What to do Next to complete the Quest and get the badges?
6:00 pm --- Event ends - THANK YOU!

#CloudStudyJam
events.how_to_find_us: UNB, Harriet Irving Library ‚Äì Milham Room (HIL Room 100)

events.name: Next '19 Extended Fredericton & Fred E-Hackathon
events.description:
Join us for this year's Next Extended event, where we'll bring together cloud enthusiasts and the developer community to be a part of the Next '19 experience.

This year, we will be diving deep into Cloud with IOT

As an attendee, you'll not be a part of our vibrant cloud community but also receive free access to Qwiklabs (a $55+ value)!

Can't wait to see you all on the "Next 19' extend" and "Fred e-hack" hackathon on June 9th! @ planet hatch from 8:00 am to 8:00 pm

To reserve your seat please don't forget to:

1- check ‚úì "going" to this event page

2- Buy your ticket from:
http://www.fredericton.ca/en/smart-fredericton/fred-ehack

We will have lots of Fun, Coding, Ideas, Prizes, Food, and Treats !!

See you there :D

Fred-eHack Agenda:
Sunday, June 9, 2019, 8am-8pm @ Planet Hatch

8:00-8:30am ‚ÄãBreakfast & Overview

8:30-10:00am ‚ÄãIdea Pitches (1 minute)
Shortlist Ideas & Break-off into Teams Based on Interest- Announce Teams

10:00am-6:30pm ‚ÄãTeam Projects

12:00-12:45pm ‚Äã Working Lunch & Team Check-in

5:30pm ‚ÄãWorking Dinner/Buffet Style (prepare for pitches)

6:30-7:45 ‚ÄãFinal Pitches / Jury Deliberation

7:45-8:00pm ‚Äã Team Prizes Awarded & Closing

‚Ä¢ City of Fredericton $500 prize for best minimum viable product (developed either with code or hardware)
‚Ä¢ City of Fredericton $500 prize based on best business use case and concept (developed with or without code)
‚Ä¢ City of Fredericton $1000 prize for the best overall idea (could include code or hardware development or simply a very strong feasible business use case)
‚Ä¢ $5,000 in-kind services from eleven-x based on the strongest project that has the best likelihood to succeed

events.name: I/O Extended 2019 Fredericton
events.description:
I/O brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and the first look at Google‚Äôs latest developer products.

We will Extend it in Fredericton with a partnership with UX Atlantic Conference (UXAC), Atlantic Canada‚Äôs largest conference on User Experience, to focus on UX Design, Usability, Accessibility and the secret keys for any successful product.

In 2 days 26th, 27th of June we will have valuable talks about :

- Designing for Accessibility
- Prototyping Voice Experiences: Design Sprints for the Google Assistant
- How Material Design Can Be Adopted and Measured for Product Success
- How to Design a Dark Theme Using Material
- Designing AR Applications
- Designing Human-Centered AI Products

Also, we will have MEAGAN TIMNEY, UX Research Lead @ Google, She will give an impressive talk about her experience with Google in UX design

AND MORE...

We will have several workshops to have hands-on experience about what you learned

Tickets available at:
https://www.eventbrite.ca/e/ux-atlantic-conference-2019-tickets-61232618410

Click attend on our meetup page to receive promo code with a big discount to attend the 2 days event

Lunch provided, swags and snacks during the event
CAN'T WAIT TO SEE YOU THERE :D :D

events.name: Fredericton DevFest 2019
events.description:
GDG DevFest 2019 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, code labs, hackathon and more! New technology-focused festival for developers! Happening *Saturday , November 16th* at *Planet Hatch* ( our community sponsor ) Meet and learn from world-class and local experts from Google and Great lead companies in Fredericton, IOT expert, cloud expert, web/mobile development experts and remember that: "when developers come together to exchange ideas, amazing things can happen".
we will discuss topics like code-splitting, brotli compression, SSR and other techniques to increase applications' performance, Gitops & Kubernetes, cloud infrastructure, IoT in the cloud, Firebase and flutter, Technology for goods and design system .. and more

you will have great connections, delicious food, you will play games and get prizes -- ALL FREE--, this event is sponsored by *Google Developers Group* we still calling for more sponsors to promise with more!

We will announce our amazing speakers and sponsors soon ...

Join us at DevFest 2019 Fredericton .. Learn, connect with people and have fun

Register here: http://meetu.ps/e/GRZ7t/w8M5N/a
we have limited spaces

more about Devfest events around the world: https://devfest.withgoogle.com/

KNOW MORE ABOUT OUR SPEAKERS
---------------------
https://sites.google.com/view/devfestfredericton/home

events.name: DevFest 2020 + Hashcode
events.description:
Let‚Äôs start in 2020 with some FUN and prizes !!
How about some TechTalks, coding hackathon and a Festival !!

GDG in partnership with UNB Dev Society and Women Techmakers brought to you the first Devfest in 2020 with a great opportunity to be part of a worldwide competition!

How can you join us ??

1 - Click to attend this event on meetup.
2 - Register in the Hashcode competition 2020 ( http://g.co/hashcode ) *by February 17th*
3 - Form a team (2 to 4) - pick a cooool name for your team *by February 20* if you don't have a team don't worry you can join one on the day of the event.
4 - Register your team in GDG Cloud Fredericton hub *by February 17*
5 - Practice, If you like !!! You will find practice examples in your account when you register, and last years' challenges! Those will help you a lot to be ready for the coming one!
6 - Wait for the suspense on February 20, at UNB Campus from 12:00 pm to 6:30 pm

Bring your laptop, and don‚Äôt forget its charger!!
Oh, but don‚Äôt worry about your charger :D we will take care of your energy to keep it up :D we will provide FREE lunch, coffee, drinks, and snacks!!

On Feb 25, 2020 results will be announced; Top teams ( Highest scores ) will be invited to a Google office Ireland for the Final Hashcode Round and Hashcode team will cover all their travel expenses and stay to compete for the final Cash Prize $$

Code with any programming language you love
SHOW THE WORLD YOUR TALENT IN CODING

events.name: IWD 2020 - Together We Rise
events.description:
We are proud to be hosting the 2020 International Women's Day Celebration, a women's tech conference. This event will highlight the stories of our growing female community of engineers, data scientists, designers, developers, and technology entrepreneurs.

This International Women's Day, we‚Äôre inviting our community to share their superpowers - those special qualities that make you shine. Whether you‚Äôre creating space for more voices to be heard or you‚Äôre working to secure funding as an entrepreneur, you‚Äôre a superhero in our book. Together let‚Äôs celebrate the super-women in our lives. Together let‚Äôs create a new narrative for our industry.
#TogetherWeRise.

Check our website for more in deep ;)
http://wtmfredericton.ca/

events.name: Firebase Study Jam [virtual]
events.description:
In light of the [COVID-19] situation, we decided to postpone our workshop for Firebase till March 28th and it will be a virtual meetup, the invite link will be shared soon!

Want to get started building web apps? Learn how to do that with Firebase! Join us for our Firebase Study Jam! Together we'll work through Firebase for web codelabs prepared by Google instructors. You will be able to get hands-on experience with Firebase

Our Speaker: Simon Gauvin

Simon Gauvin is an expert in the field of Web Development, mobile and cloud computing with 25 years of experience developing several startup software companies. He was former VP of Applications Technology at Plazmic Inc. (acquired by RIM in 2002) where he led the development of a mobile media platform for Warner Brothers and Disney in the Japanese mobile market. He completed Ph.D. research in Computer Science at Dalhousie University and has been published in several leading academic journals. Simon has authored software patents, invented and developed several new programming languages, and used this work to co-found Vizwik.com, a visual programming mobile app development platform. He recently co-founded another startup, Safelii Inc., which is using mobile and AI technology to help improve health and safety services for employees in corporations. He is also a freelance Chief Technology Officer consulting for small to medium-sized companies in Atlantic Canada.

Design Patterns with web components and Firebase
In this presentation, we will demonstrate various software design patterns that simplify the building of Web Apps using Web Components and Firestore. We present patterns for application design with respect to Authentication, View Management, Data Abstraction, and Application Architecture. We also present patterns that assist the backend development for Realtime Database, Firestore, and Storage management. These patterns are presented in the context of several real-world applications with code samples. Participants' knowledge of JavaScript is required, Familiarity with Polymer and Firebase APIs is not required, but would be an asset.

With a Firebase Study Jam, you will learn the capabilities of using Firebase for developing Web applications, share their experiences, and solve hands-on problems together. Firebase Study Jams are a great opportunity to meet with your community to learn this hot technology in person.

Join a community of like-minded developers and explore the latest Firebase for Web technologies as a team.

Attend with your laptop (PC, Mac or Chromebook)!
The labs will run on all of the latest versions of popular browsers.
For the best experience check out Get Started with Firebase for Web.
